intro: Psilosiphon otaviensis, commonly known as the Otavi sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia and Angola. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to its harsh environment. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
